definition: to break ground/to start digging/to plough/to break through the ground (of seedling)/fig. the start of a building project
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: A shoot sprouts out from the ground.
Almost before the corn was planted, up shot a large and beautiful flower.
sentences.chinese: 麥粒剛種下去，一朵美麗的大花就破土而出。

sentences.english: The first will break ground this Spring, 2000, south of Oslo.
sentences.chinese: 第一座將於2000年春在奧斯陸南郊破土動工。

sentences.english: When the world to seed weight, it will break out in their own way.
sentences.chinese: 當世界給草籽重壓時，它總會用自己的方法破土而出。

sentences.english: Within a few days, green sprouts push up through the soil and produce a green flush of grass.
sentences.chinese: 幾天內，草兒破土而出，一下子就綠了原野。

sentences.english: Plants sprout out of the ground.
When it first shoots up out of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 當它第一次破土而出時。

sentences.english: The council has approved to start building.
sentences.chinese: 委員會已批准破土動工。

sentences.english: And like a little tree growing out of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 你們的企業如同一棵樹苗剛剛破土。

sentences.english: When the world to seed weight, it will use their own methods and sprouting.
sentences.chinese: 當世界給草籽重壓時，它總會用自己的方法破土而出。

sentences.english: The first bud come out exaltedly.
Will's song writing, arrangements and drumming on this CD are ground breaking.
sentences.chinese: 會首歌的寫作，安排和擊鼓就這個光盤是破土。

sentences.english: Construction is scheduled to begin in the second quarter.
sentences.chinese: 預計新廠將於本年的第二季度破土動工。

sentences.english: The flowers are beginning to peep through the soil.
Huang pointed bamboo multi-ridden, Tomb Sweeping Festival is bursting onto the scene.
sentences.chinese: 黃尖竹多叢生，清明時節破土而出。

definition: Jingzhe or Insects Wake, 3rd of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th March
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
to have the ears of grain come up
